analysis:
Entries in art and design subjects have increased a little across the UK over the last five years. The +0.7% change compared to a change of +5.1% in all GCSE entries over the last five years. Over the same period, the 16-year-old population has changed by approximately -4.2%.

Across the UK, a greater proportion of students achieved good passes in art and design subjects in 2019 compared to all GCSE subjects. A total of 75.3% of pupils achieved grade 4/C or higher in art and design subjects compared to 67.3% for all subjects.

Across the UK, a smaller proportion of students achieved good passes in additional science in 2019 compared to all GCSE subjects. A total of 0.0% of pupils achieved grade 4/C or higher in additional science compared to 67.3% for all subjects.
